subject: Nutrition
title: Buddhist Mindful Eating
description: A 60-second lesson on Buddhist Mindful Eating.

hook.text: Buddhist monks eat one or two meals daily before noon, in silence, with complete attention to every bite.

buildup.text: The practice stems from the belief that mindful consumption reduces suffering and greed for all beings.

discovery.text: Studies of monastic eating show lower rates of obesity, diabetes, and digestive problems.

twist.text: Silicon Valley executives adopt 'monk meals' yet miss the spiritual framework that makes the practice work.

climax.text: Buddhist eating isn't a diet hack. It's an ethical practice that happens to produce remarkable health outcomes.

punchline.text: The oldest mindful eating practice is still the most effective.

quiz.question: When do Buddhist monks typically eat their meals?
